column5: Someone I know works at the Chevy dealer nearby and he hooked me up with a "test drive" in a 2016 Camaro SS. 455hp/455ft-lbs, six speed manual. What a beast! I almost traded in my truck on the spot ?
MY old v6 Hyundai would do 252 GPS speed confirmed

Art, I did 215 k once on my GPz 750. It always feels twice as fast on a bike....I miss that thing, but my riding days are done.... You should see what I have in the garage now. My brother and I restore old motorcycles and cars as a hobby. We have some good examples of the 70's and 80's Yamahas  including an RD and a RZ 350 two strokes. A  SR 500 and XS650 are our current 4 strokes. A VW convertible was a few years the winter restoration and for this year a Karmann Ghia gets restored.  Art

You should see what I have in the garage now. My brother and I restore old motorcycles and cars as a hobby. We have some good examples of the 70's and 80's Yamahas  including an RD and a RZ 350 two strokes. A  SR 500 and XS650 are our current 4 strokes. A VW convertible was a few years the winter restoration and for this year a Karmann Ghia gets restored.  Art

Supercars are neat and all, but the fact that many of them need electronic systems to be controllable kind of takes the fun out of it for me. If I had the money I'd be looking at Ariel Atom or a Caterham Super 7 for the fun to drive factor.  I've got a lot of respect for these guys. Build your own supercar.    My favorite line: "The power's good, but now it's to slow. I can't accelerate in 5th gear"
speaking of rz's, if I ever become filthy rich, I'll have an RZ 500 in the garage    and one of these, a 77 srx 440    god bless Yamaha 2 strokes
I've got a lot of respect for these guys. Build your own supercar. Now that Lotus was just insane looking and sounding!  thanks!!!
My 68 VW Beetle could hit 75 after a few miles on the 401 with the pedal flat to the floor. Replaced it with a 76 VW Rabbit, the Rabbit was quicker and actually got better gas mileage too.

I buried the needle on my Dads 69 Beetle coming down the Burlington Skyway with a huge wind at my back. 100 MPH and then the front wheels came off the ground. I've hit 200 and something KPH in my 560SEC Benz but the VW coming off the ground was scary.

You should see what I have in the garage now. My brother and I restore old motorcycles and cars as a hobby. We have some good examples of the 70's and 80's Yamahas  including an RD and a RZ 350 two strokes. A  SR 500 and XS650 are our current 4 strokes. A VW convertible was a few years the winter restoration and for this year a Karmann Ghia gets restored.  Art  You need to get yourself a Boss Hoss 502... that's 502 cubic inches!  On a road legal motor bike.

I buried the needle on my Dads 69 Beetle coming down the Burlington Skyway with a huge wind at my back. 100 MPH and then the front wheels came off the ground. I've hit 200 and something KPH in my 560SEC Benz but the VW coming off the ground was scary.  Hope you were TO bound coming down the skyway in that Bug, in 69 there was still a toll plaza on the Hamilton side.   Also had a scary moment with the front end of the Bug, hit a set of tracks at about 50 and had the steering damper go, massive wobble in the front end till i got slowed down and stopped.
Now that Lotus was just insane looking and sounding!  thanks!!!  If you liked that one you should check out these:
Thanks Tom, the 2nd link was great.  I love the look of those 70's 911's.
Give me a Ferrari F50 GT1 please.

Thanks Tom, the 2nd link was great.  I love the look of those 70's 911's.  I'm a sucker for older 911's. Look up Magnus Walker's work for some beautiful cars. But, with my stage of life it would probably be better to get that 1000hp Diaper Viper in the same video.

I'm a sucker for older 911's. Look up Magnus Walker's work for some beautiful cars. But, with my stage of life it would probably be better to get that 1000hp Diaper Viper in the same video. I will look it up tonight. I'm past the van stage now but I would still drive that one as it's the ultimate 'sleeper' out there....
speaking of rz's, if I ever become filthy rich, I'll have an RZ 500 in the garage Loving the old SRX!   My good ol'  6 speed stick Caddy V tops runs up to 165mph pretty quick still.

I can't seem to copy and paste anymore. Go to Wikipedia and enter Bugatti Veyron. It has more info than the Bugatti site.  This car has always left my head shaking. This is the most expensive and that will get you the fastest production car in the world at $1,700.000 USD. The Canadian exchange alone will buy you a Supercar.  A few crazy facts, Who makes this car? VW.
That is some crazy facts!  Wow!  A set of tires for 25 grand & I thought my set of winter tires @ $1,200.00 was expensive!!
this car has been around a while ironmaker...there are faster cars that have been developed including a car developed by koensigg that has a power to weight ratio of 1...thats right...1hp per lb.
Enjoy.  Dan.
I love Captain Slow's videos of him going sonic, that's a great one Dan but I still like his first trip more

this car has been around a while ironmaker...there are faster cars that have been developed including a car developed by koensigg that has a power to weight ratio of 1...thats right...1hp per lb.  I just saw the new Koenigsegg rims this week. They are super sweet carbon fiber deals. Much sexier than the original ones.  http://www.powernationtv.com/post/new-carbon-fiber-wheel-design-of-the-koenigsegg-regera

I just saw the new Koenigsegg rims this week. They are super sweet carbon fiber deals. Much sexier than the original ones.  http://www.powernationtv.com/post/new-carbon-fiber-wheel-design-of-the-koenigsegg-regera      Thats the regerra  the koensigg one is the fastest car in the world now top speed 273mph  base price....2.8 million
No tow package available. Meh

I know they have been around for a long time actually but an episode of a Velocity show building them reminded me. I have been saving enough to get one. Bugatti before Koenigsegg any day.  Wormdunker, that's 125 bucks a truck tire more than I paid last year, nice Coopers. If I could pay less for a new tire I would.

Ill take the veyron anyday. Man that one nice looking car!  I love that video of the british fella testing its highest speed  He says something to the effect of " at full speed the tires will blow out in 12 minutes. But dont worry, youll be outta gas in 8 minutes" hahahahah

$95,000 USD for a new set of tires too! And that doesn't cover the cost to get the wheels to France and back again with the tires mounted, oh my. Maybe the next US Prez will get 1 bullet proofed for his motorcade. Or just out run the bullet.

Well I tell yah I've been radared at 181 MPH on the highway in my younger days, on Tornado tires from CTC no less (and drove that way many nights).. and it took a few beers to not over steer even with a manual steering box! Good luck to someone with a wallet of cash and a G licence keeping that thing on the pavement at 273! Sounds like a "Gene pool" car, but then again most probably said that about me back in the late 70's/ early 80's as well....
Lol so true
That's 289 kp/h!!!! What were you driving???
Geez and I thought I was nuts getting dinged on the 502 doing 182km p/h in an 80 ???
My old 2007 Subaru Impreza (5 speed base model) did over 230kph.  It was a good car, till she rolled @ 225kph....
My intrepid was governed at 182 lol  Ive been in a few of steve arpins rally cars that sure go!!!

That's 289 kp/h!!!! What were you driving???   My intrepid was governed at 182 lol  Ive been in a few of steve arpins rally cars that sure go!!!   One of my not so finer moments...19 years old i broke up with my girlfriend on a friday night at 11pm..hopped in the car in Georgetown and made it to my cottage in pointe au baril by 12:30  I didnt go below 160 and topped my mazda speed protege out at 235.
Best I have done was on a KZ1000 152 mph or 244.6 kpm. once was enough. I had to scrub the heck out of the seat to get the stain out.   Art

Dutch the cop showed me the radar gun upside down and said "it doesn't matter it reads the same"! Told me "to pick his daughter up in my father's other car tomorrow". LOL. That was a '76 Fury Sport with a 400, it was only good for about 125. Only dated her for 3 weeks. Johnny was a town cop just sitting at the town limits and I was on the highway in OPP territory. I shut it down and rolled in behind his cruiser. We use to borrow his LTD from time to time and leave the keys in our cars so he could find us to get his cruiser back.. the good old days.  Still have the car... in parts right now as I do a full restoration. My '69 Bee, 4 gear with a 2.73:1 rear end in it vs the 3:23 that should be in there as stock. Getting close to paint while I thrash at concours restoration on all the mechanical and interior.  Dutch if you've even seen the rallye dash in a '69/70 B Body, the round speedo goes to 150 MPH, then has a 1.5 inch blank spot before you can get the needle back to the 0. That was 181 mph in mine, took about 8 miles to get it there...
Thats epic!!!
If only I was a billionaire
Art, I did 215 k once on my GPz 750. It always feels twice as fast on a bike....I miss that thing, but my riding days are done....
